newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ not worried about RBNZ response to yes RSS vote.
newsitem.headline: NZ not worried about RBNZ response to yes RSS vote.

text.p: New Zealand Treasurer Winston Peters said on Wednesday any central bank response to a positive vote in a referendum on the government retirement savings scheme (RSS) would not adversely affect the economic growth rate.

Speaking to Reuters Financial Television in Sydney and monitored in Wellington, Peters noted the Reserve Bank of New Zealand was independent, and its current forecasts did not take into account a vote in favour of compulsory pensions in the September referendum.
"We'd an expect an (RBNZ) accommodation of that result which should not have any deleterious effect on our growth strategy," Peters said.
